intro: Calamus perakensis var. lanatus, commonly known as the hairy calamus, is a member of the Aroid family (Araceae). It is a rhizomatous plant characterized by its long, slender, and often hairy stems. The plant produces戟-shaped leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in both natural and cultivated settings.
